author: A_Brickset_user
title: Sorting Hat Reveiw
review: What Hogwarts house will Harry Potter live in  noble Gryffindor, loyal Hufflepuff, wise old Ravenclaw, or cunning Slytherin? Give the Sorting Hat a spin to reveal the answer! This magical adventure set includes Harry Potter and Hedwig the owl.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: the hat
review: I don't know what you people expect, it's a sorting hat, not a supercomputer. I love it for the Hedwig and I'm sure kids would use it before they played their own little games of harry potter, all sorting themselves and all hoping for gryffindor.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: my first set
review: this was my first ever lego set, i know it isn't that good but for me it does work, the flames and owl add extra features but i have to say that the thing that spins on the front is a bit, well, naff basicaly.

author: mrmitch
title: Not impressed with this set
review: If you collect the Harry Potter theme I know you are like myself and have 6-10 of him by now. The set is out of scale with the rest of the theme. I got it because I am a collector and felt I had to have it. Disappointed in the set overall, skip it unless you really feel the need to own it.

author: deluckybrick
title: Well, Lego needed to make it...
review:
This set is the first HP set that I got, and it stayed together for about a month before I used parts of it in something else.  The hat is good, so is the cool spinning wheel, but the wheel-spin selection thing is not a good idea.  They should have thought harder than that.
Overall, this set is good, but not as good as it could be.

author: Rgijaba
title: the hats using a sorting... wheel...?
review: seems the hat is losing its old touch, eh? well, harry is a vintge minifig, useless with out peach skin... also, the little stand is oddly made, cuz the sorting hat DOESNT use a wheel, he reads your thoughts... it does come with harrys owl, and thats a plus... realy, this isnt a  set you should bother getting...

author: hustla187
title: The Wheel of the Sorting Hat
review: I actaully think this set is well thought out. The wheel does spin which makes the choice for the incoming Hogwarts student to go to which group. You get Harry Potter and the Sorting Hat which is just a wizard hat. This is a well thought out set and deserves a 5.

author: Tri_pod_king
title: Gryffidor, Gryffindor, Gryffindor- Awwww, SLYTHERIN!?!
review:
My first Harry Potter set. Brings back memories. This was a cute set and fun to play with. It included some pieces that I hadn't had before. The sorting hat, the cup, Hedwig, the torches. Although there isn't much to be said about this set. It was so very small. I'd say this set was worth the buy.

                               -Happy Thanksgiving! Don't eat too much, don't eat too little!
                                                   Tri-pod king

author: ejcmoorhouse
title: the sorting
review: i have just started liking Harry Potter agian and i love this set. the hat is good but could do with being brown. for lego this is the best way to the sorting my town's favorite T.V. show uses this a game for the guests on the show (guests are people like the king, Indaiana Jones Harry Potter etc, Famos poeple.

author: MasterBuilder
title: The Wheel of Fortune! er... Sorting!
review:
Wow...ok this set was decent just because it was one of the only sets that included Harry's owl.

Pros:
HArry's owl...
Harry himself with the rare robe with no house on it
also the witch's hat and lantern things

Cons:
poorly built
I never really got the spinny thing with the pictures on it
theres no stairs even where would you climb up?
small set, at least have one more minifig!

author: eskallon
title: Good set
review:
This is a good set that is very nice to own. It was one of the first from the harry potter line and was a great way to get harry as a figure.

Pros
You get harry
Their are extras like the owl and the goblet ad the hat.
It was a cheap set back when it came out.
The turnatable is nice

Cons
It is too big to fi in the great hall set.

Overall this is a nice set to have but not the best one out of them all.

author: BaneShake
title: Sorting Hat Review
review: I love Harry Potter. This set lives up to the name of its series. For a set of its size, Lego really did a good job. It has several moving parts (such as the stool), several great elements (the goblet, Hedwig, etc.), and provided me with many hours of entertainment when I was younger. If they could make every set with this kind of quality, Lego would be even more successful. This set is worth the buy.

author: Z_wing
title: the sorting wheel
review:
to make the set more fun for kids lego added a sorting wheel. AFOL's might not like this but I do not mind

figure
pros: harry with black tie and collar can only be found in this set, comes with extra hair
cons: none

sorting wheel
pros: seat turns, hedwigs stand turns, wheel turns
cons: none

pieces
pros: hedwig, 
cons: none

build
pros: strong, easy, quick
cons: none

price
pros: cheap, worth it
cons: none

I recommend this set to any harry potter fan
I hope you found my review helpful

author: legospongepotter
title: "I'll eat myself if you can find a smarter hat than me!"
review:
This is a great set. it is my first Harry Potter Lego Set. I am a HUGE x googolplex fan of Harry Potter. I think it is a good way to start the Lego sets as Harry's first adventure in Hogwarts is with the Sorting Hat.

Sorting Hat / Wheel:
Pros:
*Spins easily
*Torches
*Spinning seat
*Shelf, list of names (really is gibberish)
*Goblets
*Hedwig! (R.I.P.)
Cons:
*List of names falls easily 
Harry and Hat:
Pros:
*The Sorting Hat is at a strange yet cool angle when on someone's head
*Harry has his uniform, a cape, and a tiny scar
*Wand
*Thick, messy hair
Cons:
*Harry wears the Hat, but what do you do with the hair?

Overall a great set that I just love and highly recommend to any Lego-Lover
P.S. Now, after months of saving up for this as I don't have an allowance, time to save up for the more expensive Forbidden Corridor!

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Harry Potter - Sorting Hat Review
review:
This set is a good set for little money. I haven't noticed this scene in the movie but it's fun. The built of this model is quick and easy and this set is very sturdy. You also don't have to worry about stickers. This set includes another LEGO Harry Potter minifig but this time his uniform looks much different than the other uniforms of that theme. I like the printed plate with the logos for the houses 'Gryffindor', 'Slytherin', 'Ravenclaw' and 'Hufflepuff'. You also get a white owl in this set. It's a nice set to have and to play with.

All in all this set is a good set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de


Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1
Stopmotion 2
Stopmotion 3
Review

author: United_Bricks
title: Sorting hat
review:
This set comes with just Harry Potter, the Harry Potter minifig is special because it comes with a black tie not a normal red tie. You get the sorting hat what is black (it is brown in the movie). You can spin the sorting wheel  and it decides what house team you in.

Pros-

sorting wheel
white owl
map

Cons-

The sorting hat is brown not BLACK!

Overall-
8/10 nice set to get started on.

author: BobaFett2
title: Not at all based on the movie
review:
This set is certainly odd. It's not at all based on the story-no wheel was spun. And there certainly wasn't an owl behind him.

Box/Instructions

It shows Harry Jumping off a platform while the hat floats after him. I don't really understand, but it's well-done.

Parts

The best part, is, of course, the disk. It's very useful. You also get a black wizard hat, a large brown angled plate, an owl, some torches, and a few other great parts. Other notable parts include a modified 2x2 tile with TECHNIC pin sticking up, old wheel, and rotating piece.

Minifigures

Harry Potter-he's not amazing, but he's not bad. What's odd is that he has an Invisibility Cloak-he didn't have that at the time.

The build

It's pretty simple. Not exactly entertaining, but it's not bad for a set this size.

The completed model

It's odd. It does have a feature which makes for nice playability, but it really doesn't fit into the movie. And it doesn't look particularly amazing.

Summary

I like this set for a few reasons, but it doesn't fit into the movie. It makes for a great addition to a Harry Potter Collection, especially because of the dish and hat, but it doesn't fit into the theme.

author: AETerry
title: Sorting Hat Review
review:
I got this as a Christmas Stocking Stuffer... so no complaints from me there regarding the price of this set.

 

The set's alright... You get Harry Potter, his owl Hedwig and the Sorting Hat.

 

As to the Spinning Disk, I'd have designed the spinning a little bit differently so that there's a chair Harry's sitting in while wearing the Hat and the disk is behind, upright almost like a Game Show Wheel that's spun.

 

Otherwise this set isn't completely true to trying to be a scene re-enactment from the movie and Harry on the picture looks like he's running away from the Hat.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Sorcery, Hogwarts and LEGO Collide
review:
Set #4701 Sorting Hat: Ah Harry Potter. I sold off my entire collection for the sake of making more storage space for my LEGO that I was keeping and I truly don't regret the decision. The newer Harry Potter sets will be much better for my display as opposed to these older sets. That being said however they are still a great Theme and fun to collect.

 

As far as Theme's go Harry Potter is akin to a Fantasy based Castle Theme. And as far as this set goes... Well it isn't much to look at. In order to make for an exciting sorting hat based set LEGO gave us a strange looking pedestal/platform combination on which the hat rests. Using a spinning plate printed with the images of the four houses you can choose which house Harry (Or any other Mini-Figure) will be sorted into.

 

This play feature is all well and good for the first few times, but after a while there really isn't much you can do with this set. Points going for this set however are:

 

It is a cheap set. It offers a unique Harry Potter Mini-Figure with un-sorted Hogwarts uniform. You get a snowy white owl (Hedwig), the black sorting hat, a nice printed circular piece with the four houses pictured on it, an old Castle plate printed with the scroll element that all Majisto sets came with, two yellow goblets and two different wizard's wands. (The black one is used as the sorting tool.)

 

Overall I'd have to say that this set can be skipped over in any Harry Potter collection and you wouldn't be missing out on much. But if you're particularly fond of the gimmick of this set or desire a regular Hogwarts uniform without any house crests for MOCing Mini-Figs you might not want to skip over it. The pieces may also be useful in creating some sort of addition to your Hogwarts Castle. If I was to buy back all of the yellow Mini-figure sets I once had I'd probably skip this one myself though because really how many Harry Mini-Figures does a single person need? This set would have been much better if LEGO had also offered up a cheap method for getting Professor McGonagall with it.

author: HarryPotterLegoCollector
title: A good starter set, it was a must to build.
review:
This is a set they just had to build to recreate one of the first scenes at Hogwarts. When it first come out it was great value for money! 

Pros:

- It's a quick and easy build- doesn't take up too much room

- The house sorter spins and I love that its in vibrant colours

- The Harry Potter figure is unique to this set!


Cons:

- The sorting hat is black, I would prefer brown like in the films. The face on it could be nice but that might be pushing it especially in 2001.

- The seat and where the name list turns. I find this too much and not necessary, it could have work well if not better if these didn't move. 

- The name list falls out all the time which gets annoying

-There is nowhere to store the wand or hair/hat when not in use.

 

To make this set better I would have LOVED to see Professor McGonagall figure included it would have made more playable.
